title: Virgin Atlantic cuts more than 3,000 jobs to mitigate 'devastating' coronavirus impact
description: Virgin Atlantic announced it will cut 3,150 jobs, becoming the airline to announce a reduction in headcount because of the coronavirus crisis.

title: Test, trace, isolate: Governments need to do these three things before reopening economies, expert warns
description: A global health expert and physician told CNBC that easing lockdowns without taking certain action would risk a second surge in coronavirus infections.

title: Britain's NHS shuns Apple and Google as it rolls out coronavirus contact-tracing app
description: The NHS app is based on the government's "centralized" framework instead of the tech giant's "decentralized" technology.

title: UK coronavirus death toll surpasses Italy to become the highest in Europe
description: The U.K. has now surpassed Italy as the worst-hit country in Europe and is second only to the U.S. for Covid-19-related deaths worldwide, according to the official statistics for each country.

title: Six classic cocktails to make at home â€” and the stories behind them
description: In 1920, alcohol was famously outlawed in the U.S. Today, we raise our glasses with these six classic drink recipes provided by bars from around the globe.

title: Designers are now making fashion face masks and people can even buy a Billie Eilish one
description: A raft of fashion labels are now making non-medical masks to sell to consumers, including band t-shirt maker Bravado, which has made Rolling Stones, Queen and Ariana Grande versions.

title: German court says the European Central Bank now needs to prove its bond buying is needed
description: The German court said the decision does not concern any financial assistance measures taken by the European Union or the ECB in the context of the current coronavirus crisis.

title: Trust in governments surges during pandemic but people are disappointed with CEO performance
description: Governments are now more trusted than businesses, non-profits and the media, according to the Edelman Trust Barometer report.

title: The coronavirus provides a 'golden opportunity' for economic reform in the Middle East, says Majid Al Futtaim CEO
description: The next two years are going to be "very difficult" for the Middle East, where the private sector is "not as strong," said Alain Bejjani of Majid Al Futtaim.

title: UK auto sales plummet to lowest level since 1946
description: Car sales for April have hit historic lows.

title: Total's net profit falls 35% in the first quarter as oil prices slide
description: Total reported that first-quarter net profit came in at $1.8 billion, down from $2.8 billion over the same period last year.

title: Elon Musk's lavish LA mansions appear to be listed for sale days after billionaire pledged to 'own no house'
description: The homes have a combined value of $39.5 million.

title: Ferrari is now worth more than General Motors and Ford
description: Ferrari's market value surged to $30 billion Monday morning, more than the value of General Motors or Ford Motor.

title: Chinese cloud firm gears up for $3.8 billion US listing despite coronavirus uncertainty
description: Kingsoft Cloud's IPO comes amid a tough stock market environment due to the coronavirus pandemic and as scrutiny of Chinese listings in the U.S. intensifies following revelations of fraud at coffee chain Luckin Coffee.

title: Peter Thiel-backed digital bank N26 raises another $100 million, bracing for coronavirus uncertainty
description: N26's valuation remains unchanged at $3.5 billion despite the injection of new capital.

title: How New Zealand's 'eliminate' strategy brought new coronavirus cases down to zero
description: New Zealand's government claims the country could have seen thousands of coronavirus cases every day if strict lockdown measures hadn't been implemented.

title: 'This is the start of a new Cold War,' former Trump trade official says of rising US-China tensions
description: Among the latest disputes between the U.S. and China is the origin of the coronavirus, which has infected more than 3 million people and killed over 250,000 globally, data by Johns Hopkins University showed.

title: BNP Paribas' net profit slides as it warns of three 'major negative impacts' from the coronavirus
description: BNP Paribas reported a fall in net income for the first quarter on Tuesday, as it warned the coronavirus has had three "major negative impacts" on its balance sheet.

title: Coronavirus lockdown could set back India's economic recovery as banks worry about bad loans
description: Bankers and government officials already expect bad debt to potentially double as the outbreak brought economic activity to an abrupt halt, Reuters reported.

title: Vietnam is reopening and its early coronavirus containment efforts may help it avoid a recession
description: Vietnam may be able to avert a recession this year as the country is getting back to work and school after early coronavirus containment measures, said Sian Fenner, lead Asia economist at Oxford Economics.
